* Represents a note in the Zettel system.
* Each note has a unique 8-character hash-based ID, title, body, and metadata.
// ID length constant - all note IDs must be exactly 8 characters
// Static counter for tracking total notes created
private final String id; // 8-character hash-based unique identifier
private String title; // Title of the note
private String filename; // Actual filename on disk
private String body; // Body content of the note
private Instant createdAt; // Timestamp when the note was created
private Instant modifiedAt; // Timestamp when the note was last modified
private boolean pinned; // Whether the note is pinned
private boolean archived; // Whether the note has been archived
private String archiveName; // Name of the archive the note belongs to
private List<String> logs; // History/log data of that individual note
* Constructor for creating a new note by the user.
* Initializes with default values for pinned, archived, and logs.
* @param title The title of the note
* @param filename The filename for storage on disk
* @param body The body content of the note
* @param createdAt The timestamp when the note was created
* @param modifiedAt The timestamp when the note was last modified
public Note(String id, String title, String filename, String body,

* @param pinned Whether the note is pinned
* @param archived Whether the note is archived
* @param archiveName The archive name if archived, null otherwise
* @param logs The list of log entries for this note

* Main class for the Zettel CLI application.
* Handles initialization, storage setup, and the main program loop.
* Zettel is a note-taking system that uses hash-based IDs for notes.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and loads existing notes from disk.
* Displays greeting, processes commands until exit command is received.
* Implements timeout handling to prevent hanging in CI environments.
// Check if it's an exit command
* Main entry-point for the Zettel application.
public abstract void execute(ArrayList<Note> notes, UI ui, Storage storage) throws ZettelException;
* Command to delete a note by its ID.
* Supports optional force deletion to skip confirmation prompt.
* Constructs a DeleteNoteCommand with the specified note ID and force flag.
* @param noteId The 8-character hexadecimal note ID to delete
* @param force true to skip confirmation, false to prompt user
* Executes the delete command on the specified note.
* Prompts for confirmation unless force flag is set.
* @param notes The list of all notes
* @param ui The UI instance for user interaction
* @param storage The storage instance for persistence
* @throws ZettelException If the notes list is empty or the note doesn't exist
public void execute(ArrayList<Note> notes, UI ui, Storage storage) throws ZettelException {

* Exception thrown when a required description field is empty or missing.
* This exception is used to enforce that certain operations require
* Constructs a new EmptyDescriptionException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining which description field is empty
* Exception thrown when input or data is not in the expected format.
* This exception is used to indicate that the structure or format of
* the provided data does not match the required specifications.
* Constructs a new InvalidFormatException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining what format was expected
*                and how the actual format differs.
* Exception thrown when user input is invalid or cannot be processed.
* This exception is used to indicate that the user has provided input
* that does not conform to expected formats or constraints.
* Constructs a new InvalidInputException with the specified detail message.
* The message is automatically prefixed with "Invalid Input: ".
* @param message The detail message explaining what aspect of the input is invalid.
* Exception thrown when an invalid noteId is provided for note operations.
* This exception is typically thrown when the user specifies an index that is
* out of bounds or does not correspond to an existing note.
* Constructs a new InvalidNoteIdException with the specified detail message.
* The message is automatically prefixed with "Invalid Note ID! ".
* @param message The detail message explaining why the note ID is invalid.
* Exception thrown when a requested note cannot be found
* This exception is typically thrown when attempting to access, modify, or delete
* a note that is not present in the note list.
* Constructs a new NoNoteFoundException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining which note was not found.
* Exception thrown when there is no notes in the list at all.
* This exception is typically thrown when attempting to perform actions on an empty
* Constructs a new NoNoteException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining which note was not found.
* Represents the base exception class for all Zettel-related exceptions.
* This is the parent class for all custom exceptions in the Zettel application.
* Constructs a new ZettelException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the cause of the exception.
* Utility class for generating deterministic 8-character hexadecimal IDs
* based on note content and creation timestamp.

* Uses SHA-256 algorithm and takes the first 4 bytes of the hash.

* Unit tests for the Note class.
* Tests note creation, getters, setters, and hash-based ID functionality.
private final String id = "a1b2c3d4"; // 8-character lowercase hex ID
private final String body = "This is the body of the test note.";
private final Instant createdAt = Instant.now().minus(1, ChronoUnit.DAYS);
// This setup runs before each test, providing a fresh note instance
note = new Note(id, title, filename, body, createdAt, modifiedAt);
@DisplayName("Test primary constructor for new note creation")
// The note from setUp is created with this constructor
// Check default values for a new note
assertFalse(note.isPinned(), "New note should not be pinned by default.");
assertFalse(note.isArchived(), "New note should not be archived by default.");
assertNull(note.getArchiveName(), "Archive name should be null for a new note.");
assertTrue(note.getLogs().isEmpty(), "Logs should be empty for a new note.");
@DisplayName("Test full constructor for loading a note")
Note loadedNote = new Note(id, title, filename, body, createdAt, modifiedAt,
assertTrue(loadedNote.isPinned(), "Pinned status should be loaded correctly.");
assertTrue(loadedNote.isArchived(), "Archived status should be loaded correctly.");
@DisplayName("Test full constructor with null logs list")
Note loadedNote = new Note(id, title, filename, body, createdAt, modifiedAt,
assertNotNull(loadedNote.getLogs(), "Logs list should be initialized to an empty list, not null.");
assertTrue(loadedNote.getLogs().isEmpty(), "Logs list should be empty when loaded with null.");
@DisplayName("Setters should update values and modifiedAt timestamp")
// Allow a millisecond to pass to ensure Instant.now() is different

// Verify the date part matches the yyyy-MM-dd pattern
assertTrue(parts[1].matches("\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}"), "Date part should be in yyyy-MM-dd format.");
@DisplayName("Static note counter should increment on object creation")
// This test is self-contained to avoid interference from other tests' object creations
Note note1 = new Note("abcd1234", "t1", "f1", "b1", Instant.now(), Instant.now());
Note note2 = new Note("def56789", "t2", "f2", "b2", Instant.now(), Instant.now());

* Unit tests for the IdGenerator class.
@DisplayName("Generated ID should be exactly 8 characters long")
assertNotNull(id, "Generated ID should not be null");
assertEquals(8, id.length(), "Generated ID should be 8 characters long");
@DisplayName("Generated ID should contain only lowercase hexadecimal characters")
"Generated ID should only contain lowercase hex characters (0-9, a-f)");
assertEquals(id1, id2, "Same input should always generate the same ID");
assertNotEquals(id1, id2, "Different inputs should generate different IDs");
@DisplayName("Empty string input should generate valid ID")
assertNotNull(id, "ID should not be null even for empty string");
assertEquals(8, id.length(), "ID should be 8 characters even for empty string");
assertTrue(id.matches("[a-f0-9]{8}"), "ID should be valid hex even for empty string");
@DisplayName("Very long input should generate valid 8-character ID")
String longInput = "This is a very long input string that contains many characters " +
"and should still generate a valid 8-character hexadecimal ID " +
"because the hash function will compress it down to the same length";
assertEquals(8, id.length(), "ID should still be 8 characters for long input");
assertTrue(id.matches("[a-f0-9]{8}"), "ID should be valid hex for long input");
@DisplayName("Special characters in input should generate valid ID")
assertNotNull(id, "ID should not be null for special characters");
assertEquals(8, id.length(), "ID should be 8 characters for special characters");
assertTrue(id.matches("[a-f0-9]{8}"), "ID should be valid hex for special characters");
@DisplayName("Unicode characters in input should generate valid ID")
assertNotNull(id, "ID should not be null for Unicode input");
assertEquals(8, id.length(), "ID should be 8 characters for Unicode input");
assertTrue(id.matches("[a-f0-9]{8}"), "ID should be valid hex for Unicode input");
// These should all be different due to case/whitespace sensitivity
assertNotEquals(id1, id2, "Case difference should produce different IDs");
assertNotEquals(id1, id3, "Whitespace difference should produce different IDs");
assertNotEquals(id2, id3, "Different inputs should produce different IDs");
REM Normalize IDs and dates in ACTUAL.TXT
REM - Replace 8-char lowercase hex IDs (with # prefix) with #XXXXXXXX
REM - Replace 8-char lowercase hex IDs (standalone) with XXXXXXXX
REM - Replace dates in format YYYY-MM-DD with XXXX-XX-XX
REM Normalize IDs and dates in EXPECTED.TXT
FC ACTUAL-NORMALIZED.TXT EXPECTED-NORMALIZED.TXT >NUL && ECHO Test passed! || ECHO Test failed!
# 1. Replace 8-char lowercase hex IDs with # prefix: #abcd1234 -> #XXXXXXXX
# 2. Replace standalone 8-char lowercase hex IDs at end of line or before space
# Copy and convert EXPECTED.TXT line endings
# 1. Replace 8-char lowercase hex IDs with # prefix
